reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights on 29th july 2012, , the rooms are very basic but for the price NO ONE SHOULD COMPLAIN! the food is very good, my only beef is,..... i went to breakfast, before i went i sent a text message, i put my phone on the chair and covered it with my jacket, when i got back 30 mins later, i went straight to my phone which wasent there!! i looked in the drawers on the floor and all around, no joy, the cleaners were in the next room so i pulled them, they were looking very shifty, i told them im off to report it!! then one cleaner pulled the bed out and Hey presto there was my trusty old phone! it must have just visualised, because i looked in that place, so my phone got up and walked 6 feet on its own, it hid from me then realised it needed topping up and came back to Daddy! anyway,after some consideration, i decided to let the reception staff know about it, they wasent bothered, dident even want to know my room number, the reason ive told you about this is i dont want it to happen to you, so keep all your personals close to you, the entertainment was ok and so was the bingo, my girlfriend won £100 and shared it between 6 of us bless her!
reviews.title: Be aware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Grand Burstin on Fri. the 29th of June, the time was 5 o'clock. A receptionist came onto the coach and explained what the " crack " was. As we got off the coach, she gave us our room keys, telling us which floor we were on and which wing and therefore avoiding the need to queue at reception. Our room was fairly basic but adequate and at least it was clean. We were overlooking the harbour, which to be fair isnt the best view in the world but we had asked for a sea view and at least we got it!! We ate in the Harbour restaurant and found the food to be of a high standard considering what we had paid. There was plenty of choice and certainly no need to go hungry. All the staff were polite and friendly and although this hotel is past its "Glory Days" in terms of decor it was okay.
reviews.title: It was Burstin at the seams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you've not been to the Burstin before dont let some of the negative reviews put you off. We have been to lots of places, from B & B's to 5 star hotels and I can honestly say that in terms of value for money this place is in our top 10. Granted its not the Ritz, but our trip with National Holidays was excellent value........and we would certainly use them again.
reviews.title: Not One Of England's Finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last tip....my husband says dont buy 2 large whiskys with "dashes" at the bar!! They cost £10.20 and it nearly broke his heart after all we could have bought a bottle for that in Sainsburys!! Still we were on holiday so not to worry..............
reviews.title: The Burstin Continues To Be A Value For Money Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly I had a problem with the booking, made through Booking.com because the hotel entered my credit card expiry date details incorrectly (twice) which resulted in the room being cancelled (checked with credit card why card declined and they confirmed it was operator error at the hotel)Arrived late on Saturday night. Doorman lacked charm and humour when asked whether we had a reservation. He was refusing entry to anyone without a room key or card. At check in the receptionist mirrored the doorman. No warm welcome here, just practicalities. Once checked in we had to walk through the entertainment lounge to get to the lift to get to our room. It was teeming with a DJ, loud music and many patrons drinking in the very big lounge. All eyes on two people walking through with suitcases. Room was fine and clean. Decent shower and bathroom but room was a twin when a double was requested (resulted from credit card error detailed above). Didn't fancy breakfast in the morning so cannot comment on the food or service.
reviews.title: Nice weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We`ve heard some conflicting opinions on this hotel, some admittedly dating back a few years. We decided to give it a try and were very pleasantly surprised. Clean tidy and well equipped room - good wifi and TV channels. Parking was very crowded so arrive early. There was live entertainment but we didnt try it. Bar snacks seemed very reasonably priced. All the staff were very polite and helpful. At £30 per room per night with breakfast its outstanding value.
reviews.title: A real surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was that the breakfast hot section was quite bland - cheap ingredients I think - but the range of items was more than enough to fill up on. We were lucky enough to have a sea view.
reviews.title: £40 on lastminute.com..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This room cost me £40, this is probably the cheapest hotel I’ve ever stayed in; it is also the most overpriced! The room was filthy, dirty toilets, filthy shower and just so run down. I would rather kip in my car next time I take the channel tunnel.
reviews.title: Good value.....

reviews.text: I am often surprised by reviews I read by other reviewers, I am not sure what they expect but for value for money you can't really go wrong with this hotel. The staff were friendly and welcoming, lots of things to do both in the hotel and locally. The room was clean and although it is a bigger hotel than normally we book into there was a wide range of activities for all age groups and tastes. Would definitely recommend it!
reviews.title: Dirty filthy and that's the reception the room was worse!
A very enjoyable stay !
reviews.text: Arrived at 11pm to the met outside the hotel by guests smoking and singing.
You certainly won't have trouble finding the Grand Burstin - it's huge.
reviews.title: It's massive!

reviews.text: It's certainly an experience. I'm not one for seaside towns and the Burstin seems to be a typical example of the big, waterfront, faded-glory hotel. Staff were pleasant and friendly - no complaints here. Room is clean, decor throughout is frankly painful but my room was a bargainous £25 per night, so no complaints from me. My room seems nice and quiet too. I arrived just in time to be the last person served at the bar. I've ordered a house double whisky which is something called "Claymore". It's currently sitting on my table looking threatening. Will I wake up in the morning? Who knows.
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately breakfast starts too late for me to sample the cooked option, because I have to leave to make the ferry, but I regularly stay at the Britannia Newcastle Airport and so I reckon breakfast is likely to be the same: an extremely average selection of full english items, with very suspicious scrambled egg, but superb fried bread and black pudding. Just warn your arteries beforehand and you'll be fine.
reviews.title: Too busy to be renovated, but what a bargain in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points!
reviews.title: AVOID

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Well located for the ferry at Dover
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful

reviews.text: Just come back from a night's stay at this hotel (4th July) for a night's rest after our ferry must
reviews.title: Great Price.

reviews.text: say what great value for money this hotel is, the room was very good, with every thing you need for a night's stay, ie tea coffee making, TV, even iron with ironing board, clean bedding,
reviews.title: Short break in Folkestone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very happy, housekeeping had not quite done their job im afraid to say, there was a broken hanger in the wardrobe with a used tissue laying next to it, in the bathroom there was a half empty bottle of shampoo in the bath, and the toilet brush holder contained debris from the toilet
reviews.title: good hotel shame just a number

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: looked like the final inspection hadn't been done, on the whole, the food which we ate in the bar section was plentiful couldn't move after attempting to finish it, great price, would stay again when down that way.
reviews.title: God's waiting room!

reviews.text: This is a hotel which has a wonderful position and although it is always teeming with people we were able to sleep very well in the newly refurbished upper floor rooms. Alas without a window but a skylight. Not really a problem but quite light in the early mornings. The food in the Victorian Restaurant was good and the service excellent, it was cool and peaceful,just £5 extra pp for breakfast and dinner. The 2nd night we ate in the Harbour Restaurant same food really and service so so, but okay. Folkestone is definitely mixed, good shopping up the top and a lovely beach down at the sea front, but with so much of UK, closed shops and not the place to walk late at night. Rock Salt on the harbour is a michelin guide restaurant we just had a drink on the roof terrace blankets supplied for cold days. Fantastic . Grand Burstin recommendable its what it is. The best for the price. Do it and expect what is offered. (Swimming pool not the best but clean tidy and very old)
reviews.title: I can't believe places like this still exist!
